summary: The Plum Island Preservation Study Act mandates the Secretary of the Interior to study Plum Island in New York to determine the suitability of designating it as a unit within the National Park System or National Wildlife Refuge System, or protecting its resources through other means. The study area includes the island itself and all associated assets. The Secretary must consult various entities, assess national significance, and provide cost estimates for potential actions. A report with findings and recommendations must be submitted to relevant congressional committees within three years of funding.
